definitions.definition: To bring in as a member ; to make a part of.
examples: Franklin was inducted into the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame in 1987, the first female inductee [ … ]

definitions.definition: To formally or ceremoniously install in an office , position , etc.
examples: It is my pleasure to induct the new Officers for this coming term.

definitions.definition: To introduce into (particularly if certain knowledge or experience is required , such as ritual adulthood or cults ).
examples: She was inducted into the ways of the legal profession.
At the time of war the President is authorized by law to induct persons into the armed forces involuntarily.
The ceremonies in the gathering were first inducted by the Venetians.

main_definition: To bring in as a member ; to make a part of.
secondary_definitions: To formally or ceremoniously install in an office , position , etc.
To introduce into (particularly if certain knowledge or experience is required , such as ritual adulthood or cults ).
( obsolete ) To introduce ; to bring in.
